title: altair_tech
author: altair_tech
content: About 30% of the new whatsminers we've purchased over the last few months are DOA on one hashboard (typically error 540, 541 and 542). We started purchasing whatsminer in 2020 after the Antminer S17 series reliability issues, but it appears that whatsminers are having the same issues now. Anyone else notice a drop in quality from MicroBT?

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: altair_tech on June 08, 2022, 06:08:24 PMAbout 30% of the new whatsminers we've purchased over the last few months are DOA on one hashboard (typically error 540, 541 and 542). We started purchasing whatsminer in 2020 after the Antminer S17 series reliability issues, but it appears that whatsminers are having the same issues now. Anyone else notice a drop in quality from MicroBT?I haven't had any experience with the latest whatsminers, but I've noticed that many miners are pretty particular about what pool they're mining on.  What pool are you mining on with them?  It might help some of the sleuths around here get to the bottom of your issue.  I would also recommend trying out a couple different pools and seeing if you're having the same problem with them all if you have time to troubleshoot.  You might find that it's more profitable to mine somewhere else based on your hardware.  Just a thought of something to try to help diagnose the issue.

comments.author: altair_tech
comments.body: I'm mining with ViaBTC Pool. This is a hardware issue that i don't think is related to the pool. I have to remove the one problematic hashboard to make the miner work on the remaining hashboards.

comments.author: GFDhd
comments.body: I'm not familiar with whatsminer, but I think there may be some problem with your hashboard, these error codes usually refer to the wrong number of chips, I think there may be a soldering fault.

comments.author: Donnybrasko
comments.body: Hi did you manage to find a solution to this?My batch of whatsminer are also 30% DOA with the same error codes.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: m30s m50s or m60sI lost one m50 board to 540 542 issues.I have two m30s both goodI have four m50s three good fourth has the 540 542 error

comments.author: Donnybrasko
comments.body: M30s+ and how long did you have them before they started erroring? Also did you end up finding a solution for it?

comments.author: Sledge0001
comments.created_time: April 07, 2024, 01:08:53 AMLast edit: April 07, 2024, 01:31:00 AM by Sledge0001
comments.body: I have many WM50's about 3 of the batch of 48+ ordered went back for warranty service.I think they are great overall and the ones that worked are still hashing. Also note... Fastboot on these is meh...

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: Sledge0001 on April 07, 2024, 01:08:53 AMI have many WM50's about 3 of the batch of 48+ ordered went back for warranty service.I think they are great overall and the ones that worked are still hashing. Also please... fastboot on these is meh...warm up time is stupid slow

Also please... fastboot on these is meh...warm up time is stupid slowAgreed compared to a Bitmain S series product it's really really slow

Also please... fastboot on these is meh...warm up time is stupid slowAgreed compared to a Bitmain S series product it's really really slowyou want really fast buy the epic controller it makes the bitmain t21 close to instant.it also makes the s19xp close to instant.they are making a controller for the whatsminer I have to get one and try it.

comments.author: CochnocherCrypto
comments.body: haven't personally purchased any (as you know, I buy a lot of Bitmain machines from you guys at Altair!) WM machines - but I HAVE seen similar complaints on Reddit regarding the M50/S+M60/S having QC issues.
